intro: Boehmeria heterophylla, commonly known as the Indian nettle or Chinese nettle, is a flowering plant species native to Asia. It belongs to the family Urticaceae, which includes many stinging nettle species. The plant is characterized by its alternate, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of small, greenish-white flowers. Boehmeria heterophylla is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and stream banks. Its fibrous stems have been historically used in traditional crafts and textiles.
